Molecule C Class: gallotannins broken down by esterases in the GI tract, is a leading cause of poisoning in horses[https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/agricultural-and-biological-sciences/acer-rubrum]
Medicinal: Quebecol from Red maple is being investigated for use in cosemetics.  Mapalexin compounds have shown in vitro activity that may asist in the management of blood glucose. Pyrrogallol is created through the breakdown of gallotannins from wilted and dry leaves in the GI tract, and can lead to poisioning in horses.
General Information: State tree of Rhode Island's and common early succession species in Eastern Forests.  Like Acer saccharum, the sugar maple, sap can used for the production of maple syrup.  Folk Medicine uses include complaints of the eye, skin, use as a tonic, and vermifuge.[https://phytochem.nal.usda.gov/phytochem/ethnoPlants/show/267?qlookup=acer+rubrum&offset=0&max=20&et=]

Molecule B Name: 65 distinct bioactive compounds have been identified in Aloe[https://phytochem.nal.usda.gov/phytochem/plants/show/97?part=&_ubiq=&ubiq=on]
Medicinal: Aloe is used in laxitive preparations and for topical preparations to heal skin from cuts and burns.
General Information: Used in  wound healing for ﬁrst- to second-degree burns. Juice taken internally taken as a laxative.

Used in Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) for more than 5,000 years, primarily to treat asthma or bronchitis. Has many other benefecial uses such as pain relief, feverfuge, to help weight loss, treat cardiovascular diseases.  Ephedrine and pseodoephedrine are nervous system stimulant and have been abused as a weight loss and performance enhancing drugs resulting in high profile deaths in the 1990's.  Psuedoephedrine is naturally occuring, though most commercial ephedrine used for respitory ailments today is synthesised using specialized stands of yeast.

Medicinal: Vincristine, vinlastine and vinorelobine inhibit microtubule formation in dividing cells, arresting cell development
General Information: Source of vincristine and vinblastine, anticancer drugs used in the chemotherapy treatment of various types of cancer. Can be dangerous if consumed.

Medicinal: Pectin was formerly used as an overcounter treatment for diahrrea, bananas have traditionally been used in this way.  Phosophatidycholine occurs in green bananas, also in the mucous layer of the colon, suggesting its use for gastrointenstional compaints.[https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6627159/] . Tradional medicine have use every part of the banana for a variety of medicinal and economic uses.  Various parts of the plant have shown anti-microbial activity.
General Information: Bananas are the world's largest herbaceous perrenial and a valuable high energy food. Bananas are an excellent source of potassium, vitamin B6 and contain moderate amounts of vitamin C, manganese and dietary fiber.   Traditional medicinal uses of Musaceae species include treatments for diarrhea and ulcers and over 100 other common ailments.[https://phytochem.nal.usda.gov/phytochem/ethnoPlants/show/352?qlookup=banana&offset=0&max=20&et=]

Medicinal: Studies are underway investigating antiviral, antimicrobrial, antihypertensive, immunmodulating and heptoprotective qualities.  Widely used to in the management of diabetes because of hypoglycemic activity and use as a sugar substitute.
General Information: Widely grown for its sweet leaves, which contain steviol glycosides responsible for its sweet taste.  Used as a sugar substitute, also shows promise for anti-inflammatory, immunmodulating, and antomicrobial effects

Medicinal: Reserpine slows the activity of the central nervous system.  It has been used for psyciatric use and blood vessel disorders.  Ajmalicine has been used for blood vessel disorders.
Toxicity: Yes. Lipid soluable and can cross blood brain barrier.  Reserprine inhibits uptake of important neurotransmitters.
General Information: Reserpine is an alkaloid first isolated from R. serpentina and was widely used as an antihypertensive drug.

Medicinal: Coffee is native to Ethiopia and the first evidence of a commercial coffee trade is found in Yemen.  During Sufi religious rituals coffee would be consumed for its stimulating effects.
General Information: Coffea arabica is believed to be the first species of coffee to be cultivated, being grown in southwest Ethiopia for well over 1,000 years. Caffeine is the most widely used stimulant worldwide.

Source of industrial sugar and ethanol production.  Folk medicine treatment for wide variety of complaints from constipation to coughs, and has been used externally to treat skin problems and aid in wound healing. Both the roots and stems are used in Ayurvedic medicine to treat skin and urinary tract infections, as well as for bronchitis, heart conditions, loss of milk production, cough, anemia, and constipation.
Fruit and the tree's latex are rich in papain, a protease used for tenderizing meat and other proteins.
Juice of the pomegranate may be effective in reducing heart disease risk factors, including LDL oxidation.

Often called the "fivepound lemon" due to its huge size the Ponderosa Lemon is believed to be a bybrid between a lemon and a citron, although it has never been verified. May be useful for lowering the risk factors for specific types of kidney stones. Being rich in Vitamin C can help prevent one from gettimg scurvy.
Aristolochic acid has been shown to be both a potent carcinogen and kidney toxin. The flower is fly pollinated and emits and odor of rotting meat

The sap of agaves has long been used in Central America as a binding agent for various powders used as poultices on wounds. The sap can also be taken internally in the treatment of diarrhoea, dysentery etc[254]. The sap is antiseptic, diaphoretic, diuretic and laxative. Parts of the plant can also be used for aching, treating syphillis,
Leaves and leaf buds are used to produce tea. Used in traditional Chinese medicine to treat asthma
The indigenous Bundjalung people of  Australia use as a traditional medicine to treat coughs and colds
Used to provide a soothing coating for inflammations in the respiratory,  and urinary tracts.

Kava kava is an extract from the plant Piper methysticum that grows in several Pacific island chains. Kava kava has been used for thousands of years in Pacific cultures during rituals, social gatherings, and for medicinal purposes. The active components called kavalactones are found mostly in the root and rhizome (underground horizontal stem) of the plant. The kavalactones are thought to help decrease anxiety and relax muscles, possibly by a mechanism similar to the benzodiazepine family of sedatives.however, have been banned in some Euroean countries due to it being believed to cause liver damage

Cocoa, scientifically known as Theobroma cacao, is a small evergreen tree native to South America. Its seeds are used to make cocoa powder and chocolate. It is economically important as cocoa butterextracted from the seeds is widely used in the confectionery industry.
Castor oil is a laxative that has been used for over 2,000 years. The oil is also an industrial lubricant. The seed coat contains the potent poison Ricin.
Extracts from the bark of the Pacific and common yew are used in treatment for ovarian and breast cancer.
